name: places/ChIJq98Kfb1ZwokRUvcHo_j9vM8
adrFormatAddress: 466 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: If you are considering walking into Jason & Co, do it. Last week, after walking into multiple jewelers (they weren’t in for the day, weren’t open, etc.), I’m so happy I walked into Jason’s beautiful store on my lunch break. After my wedding, my bridesmaids put all of my necklaces in one box and I opened it to find them tangled. I tried for two weeks to get them out and couldn’t, so I took it to him. As soon as I walked in, I got great vibes. He was funny, charming, authentic, and more than willing to help. We joked around for a few minutes and it actually brightened my day, even though it wasn’t a bad one to begin with. He had such a quick turn around, even after working on it for hours relentlessly (one had three letters, another had a pearl drop, and the other was a large angel from my mother, so the shapes were tricky). As a former business owner, I’m a big believer in customer service. Kindness and leadership matters, and Jason showed all of those things. I don’t care where I live or work in the city now, my business will always be with him.

originalText.text: I was so thrilled to find Jason & Co. I had been looking for a good jeweler for years and took a chance on this place after reading reviews online. So happy I did. Helped me replace stones in a set of earring I inherited and then also helped create beautiful necklaces out of the older stones. He was so friendly, warm and did an incredible job with all the pieces I brought in. 10/10 would recommend.

text.text: I was so thrilled to find Jason & Co. I had been looking for a good jeweler for years and took a chance on this place after reading reviews online. So happy I did. Helped me replace stones in a set of earring I inherited and then also helped create beautiful necklaces out of the older stones. He was so friendly, warm and did an incredible job with all the pieces I brought in. 10/10 would recommend.

originalText.text: I highly, HIGHLY recommend Jason for your jewelry repair needs. The night before a holiday (MLK Day), my engagement ring was accidentally crushed and the band got totally warped. The next day, all the other shops in the neighborhood that offered repair services were closed for the day, but Jason’s store was still open like a beacon of hope. I was able to walk in, he had no doubts about being able to fix my ring, gave me a very reasonable estimate, and told me to come pick it up the next day. When I came by again, I asked him to make a slight adjustment (my fault for not being clear the first day) and he said it was no problem, asked me to send a picture of exactly how I wanted the ring to look, and he called me when it was ready and perfect! It looked even better than the day of my proposal because he had polished it for me. The cost matched the estimate. Jason is a true professional of his craft, communicative, easy-going and so friendly. He can be trusted with the ones that have serious sentimental value.

originalText.text: Jason is hands down the best jewelry repair I've been to. He replaced the latch loop on 2 of my necklaces for only $10! He is also charming and very helpful with exactly what you're looking for.

text.text: Jason is hands down the best jewelry repair I've been to. He replaced the latch loop on 2 of my necklaces for only $10! He is also charming and very helpful with exactly what you're looking for.

originalText.text: Jason was incredibly pleasant to speak with and very professional. I brought in two  necklaces that were recent gifts and he was able to alter both lengths perfectly by the next morning. He also had them cleaned up a bit at no extra cost. Will return!!
